content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-198-15-A |Item_parent=Microcrystalline arthropathies |Item_parent_short=Microcrystalline arthropathies |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the two essential biological tests for the diagnosis of gout |Description=uricemia, estimation of glomerular filtration rate (MDRD or CKD-EPI) |Section=Additional tests |Contributors= |Order=15}} - Uricemia, which may be normal during a gouty attack - Serum creatinine with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR, using MDRD or CKD-EPI formulae) - A blood count will also be taken.

question.title: What is one of the essential biological tests for the diagnosis of gout?

option_a.title: Uric acid level
option_a.description: A test that measures the level of uric acid in the blood

option_b.title: Serum creatinine with eGFR
option_b.description: A test that estimates the glomerular filtration rate using serum creatinine

option_c.title: Blood count
option_c.description: A test that measures various components of blood

option_d.title: Uricemia
option_d.description: A condition characterized by high levels of uric acid in the blood

correct_option.title: Correct Option
